segments.text: I see the water pouring over the sink, and it’s actually kind of funny.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying a plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the kids sneaking cookies, and I can’t help but smile.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like a little acrobat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so eager, reaching out with her hand like she’s begging for a treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this whole scene is like a silent comedy, just waiting for the punchline.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure entertainment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the water or the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope she doesn’t turn around too fast, or she might slip on that puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is one of those moments that’s just too perfect, like a snapshot of life.
segments.speaker: PAR
